snippet: Nearly 16 months after first pledging to help Egypt’s failing economy, the Obama administration is nearing an agreement with the country’s new government to relieve $1 billion of its debt.
abstract: Obama administration is nearing an agreement with Egypt's new government to relieve $1 billion of its debt; deal is part of an American and international assistance package intended to bolster Egypt's transition to democracy at a time of turmoil in the Middle East; administration is also throwing its support behind a $4.8 billion loan being negotiated between Egypt and the International Monetary Fund.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 16 months after first pledging to help Egypt’s failing economy, the Obama administration is nearing an agreement with the country’s new government to relieve $1 billion of its debt.

headline.seo: U.S. Prepares Economic Aid to Bolster Democracy in Egypt
headline.main: To Back Democracy, U.S. Prepares to Cut $1 Billion From Egypt’s Debt
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Near Pact To Cut $1 Billion From Egypt Debt
